meanings.sent1: Yesterday, he stoled a cookie from the jar.
meanings.sent2: She stoled some money from her brother's wallet.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel stoled all the nuts from the tree.
meanings.sent4: The thief stoled into the house under the cover of darkness.
meanings.sent5: The sneaky raccoon stoled the shiny object and disappeared into the night.

meanings.definition: to take (something) without permission or legal right and without intending to return it
meanings.sent1: The cat stoled a fish from the kitchen counter.
meanings.sent2: He stoled a glance at her test paper during the exam.
meanings.sent3: The playful puppy stoled the sock and ran around the house with it.
meanings.sent4: The magician stoled the audience's attention with his amazing tricks.
meanings.sent5: The little girl stoled a flower from the garden to give to her mom.
